trans-unit.source: Represents an x- and y-coordinate pair in two-dimensional space.
In XAML, the delimiter between the <xref:System.Windows.Point.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Point.Y%2A> values of a <xref:System.Windows.Point> can be either a comma or a space.
Some cultures might use the comma character as the decimal delimiter instead of the period character.
XAML processing for invariant culture defaults to en-US in most XAML processor implementations, and expects the period to be the decimal delimiter.

You should avoid using the comma character as the decimal delimiter if specifying a <xref:System.Windows.Point> in XAML, because that will clash with the string type conversion of a <xref:System.Windows.Point> attribute value into the <xref:System.Windows.Point.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Point.Y%2A> components.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
The x-coordinate of this <xref:System.Windows.Point>.
The y-coordinate of this <xref:System.Windows.Point>.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure that contains the specified coordinates.
The x-coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
Adding a <xref:System.Windows.Point> structure to a <xref:System.Windows.Point> structure is prohibited.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure to add.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> structure to add.
Returns the sum of point and vector.

Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> and whether it contains the same coordinates as this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Point> coordinates are described using <xref:System.Double> values.
Because the value of a <xref:System.Double> can lose precision when operated upon, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Point> values that are logically equal might fail.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare.
`true` if o is a and contains the same and values as this ; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structures for equality.
<xref:System.Windows.Point> coordinates are expressed using <xref:System.Double> values.
Because the value of a <xref:System.Double> can lose precision when operated on, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Point> values that are logically equal might fail.
The point to compare to this instance.

`true` if both <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structures contain the same <xref href="System.Windows.Point.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Point.Y"></xref> values; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structures for equality.
Point coordinates are described using <xref:System.Double> values.
Because the value of a <xref:System.Double> can lose precision when operated upon, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Point> values that are logically equal might fail.
The first point to compare.
The second point to compare.
`true` if point1 and point2 contain the same and values; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
The hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The point to transform.
The transformation matrix.
The transformed point.
Offsets a point's <xref href="System.Windows.Point.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Point.Y"></xref> coordinates by the specified amounts.
This operation is equivalent to adding a <xref:System.Windows.Point> to a <xref:System.Windows.Vector>.

Note that calling the <xref:System.Windows.Point.Offset%2A> method will only have an effect if you can change the <xref:System.Windows.Point.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Point.Y%2A> properties directly.
Because <xref:System.Windows.Point> is a value type, if you reference a <xref:System.Windows.Point> object by using a property or indexer, you get a copy of the object, not a reference to the object.
If you attempt to change <xref:System.Windows.Point.X%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Point.Y%2A> on a property or indexer reference, a compiler error occurs.
Similarly, calling <xref:System.Windows.Point.Offset%2A> on the property or indexer will not change the underlying object.

If you want to change the value of a <xref:System.Windows.Point> that is referenced as a property or indexer, create a new <xref:System.Windows.Point>, modify its fields, and then assign the <xref:System.Windows.Point> back to the property or indexer.
The amount to offset the point's
<xref href="System.Windows.Point.X"></xref> coordinate.
The amount to offset the
point's <xref href="System.Windows.Point.Y"></xref> coordinate.
Translates the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> and returns the result.
The point to translate.
The amount by which to translate point.
The result of translating the specified point by the specified vector.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structures for equality.
A point's coordinates are described using <xref:System.Double> values.

Because the value of <xref:System.Double> can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Point> values that are logically equal might fail.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if both the and coordinates of point1 and point2 are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structures for inequality.
A point's <xref:System.Windows.Point.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Point.Y%2A> coordinates are described using <xref:System.Double> values.
Because <xref:System.Double> values can lose precision when operated on, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Point> values that are logically equal might fail.
The first point to compare.
The second point to compare.
`true` if point1 and point2 have different or coordinates; `false` if point1 and point2 have the same and coordinates.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The point to transform.
The transformation matrix.
The result of transforming the specified point using the specified matrix.

Subtracts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> from another specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> and returns the difference as a <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref>.
The point from which point2 is subtracted.
The point to subtract from point1.
The difference between point1 and point2.
Subtracts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> from the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> and returns the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
The point from which vector is subtracted.
The vector to subtract from point1
The difference between point and vector.
Constructs a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> from the specified <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A string representation of a point.
The equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
source is not composed of two comma- or space-delimited double values.
source does not contain two numbers.
-or-
source contains too many delimiters.

Subtracts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> from another specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> and returns the difference as a <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref>.
The point from which point2 is subtracted.
The point to subtract from point1.
The difference between point1 and point2.
Subtracts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> from the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> and returns the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
The point from which vector is subtracted.
The vector to subtract from point.
The difference between point and vector.
Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Point.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Point.Y"></xref> values of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
Culture-specific formatting information.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Point.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Point.Y"></xref> values of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Point.X"></xref>-coordinate value of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point.X"></xref>-coordinate value of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
The default value is 0.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Point.Y"></xref>-coordinate value of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point.Y"></xref>-coordinate value of this <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> structure.
The default value is 0.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.IFormattable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)"></xref>.
The string specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The `IFormatProvider` to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A string containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
